poem:
Title: The Ballot Dance

Europe, ripe in her efforts,
a weighing scale teetering.
Votes - like plums in a hand, heavy,
Pedro speaks of progress, regression.
Graffiti on future's blank canvas,
we paint with inked fingers.
Oh Europe, the dance begins,
at the polling stations, under the clock's slow nod,
Unseen, but deeply felt -
The progress, the regression,
The painting, still fresh.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "EU elections 2024: Millions across Europe head to the polls in final day of voting – live 9.58am BST Spain’s prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, has sought to stress the importance of these elections, painting a stark picture of what he believes is at stake. He told reporters: It’s our vote that decides if the future we’re building in Europe and, consequently also in Spain, is a future of progress or a future of regression. It". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
